item.title: Report E-2023030776
item.description:
Report E-2023030776

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T18:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: BATTLE MOUNTAIN
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: B.J. CECIL TRUCKING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver began in Valmy, NV. Drove to Carlin NV and proceeded to load sulfuric acid at Loading Dock TK-49. Our driver successfully completed loading. But while he was securing his dome lid, he hand-tightened the lid and failed to follow with his wrench. Our belief is that the T-bolts may have been secured at that moment, but eventually, due to vibration, rattled loose. That would explain the delayed release of product. While traveling west on the I-80, there are no major turns until the driver came to his destination exit. This is where event happened. No trace of further product on the roadway, besides Phoenix Mine property. All remediation on Mine property was handled in-house. An employee drove the route and searched for other signs of spillage. Traces only found on exit ramp and NGM property. Driver discovered he was leaking upon arrival to NGM property while badging into property. The driver investigated and secured tanker. Response teams remediated area. The NRC, NVHP, and NGM were notified of the incident. We've called Envirocare out of Elko to help with the remediation. Shortly after the incident, it began to rain and eventually snowing. Area samples taken by Envirocare suggested acid has been somewhat neutralized.

item.title: Report E-2023030568
item.description:
Report E-2023030568

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T18:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-22
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal URE experienced a UN3267 "Versacure RAC 9969 US" release from a 55-gallon poly drum to the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released from a 55-gallon poly drum to an 8’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor. The drum was releasing due to a friction hole caused by other drums on the pallet. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: XPO Terminal ULV contacted ERTS to report that their terminal had a 3-gallon spill of regulated UN1823 "Pels Caustic Soda Beads" that was released from a 55-gallon metal drum during the unloading process. The caller stated that terminal personnel punctured the container with a forklift. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-pounds of product released to a 15' x 6' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All released product and cleanup debris was collected into a 5 gallon and 15 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal ULV contacted ERTS to report that 1-cup of regulated UN2922 "AQUCAR GA 45 Water Treatment Microbiocide" Corrosive liquid, toxic, n.o.s. was released from a 55-gallon poly drum during unloading due to an unknown cause. The caller stated that the release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to the top and side of the drum located in the dock due to a loose bung cap. The damaged drum, impacted absorbent pads and poly sheeting were placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal ULV contacted ERTS to report an unspecified amount of potentially regulated material that was released inside Trailer #3115358. The caller stated that there was a strong odor, and they were unable to access the trailer or identify the product that was released. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1422 ET, Patriot arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 gallons of Xylene released to a 10' x 2' area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below from a 5 gallon metal drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and then collected. All waste was collected and containerized into (2) 55 gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: Las Vegas
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS RAMP IN LAS VEGAS, NV A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS OBSERVED LEAKING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE BOX CONTAINED COIL CLEANER, POTENTIAL UNDECLARED DG. PER THE ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTS THE PRODUCT IS CLASSIFIED AS UN1824 CORROSIVE LIQUID, BASIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S TECHNICAL NAME SODIUM HYDROXIDE. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE PACKAGING, AND NO SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS WAS OFFERED WITH THE SHIPMENT. THE INVOLVED PACKAGE IS BEING HELD PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report I-2022110212
item.description:
Report I-2022110212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-21
  • City: Wadsworth
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRI-STATE MOTOR TRANSIT CO INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. Tri-State Motor Transit driver arrived to pick up trailer and attach to tractor. Upon arrival, a leak was detected coming from nose of trailer, while trailer was parked in lot. Absorbent material was applied to contain the free product and secure site, prior to contractor arrival. Clean Harbors Environmental Services was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Clean Harbors secured the area and monitored trailer until field crew arrived. Clean Harbors proceeded to locate the Ieaking drum inside the trailer, which was one 55-gallon poly overpack, which was discovered with a pinhole leak. Approximately 4 gallons of free product released to trailer floor and asphalt beneath trailer. Clean Harbors proceeded to overpack the leaking drum, used absorbents to clean trailer floor, and recovered all spent absorbent utilized on parking lot, which were placed with Ieaking drum inside overpack. Drum was left on trailer to continue on to destination, as waste. There were no injuries or exposures reported. Attached copy of waste manifest 002036160

  • Description: XPO Logistic Terminal ULV reported 1-55 gallon poly drum of UN2984 "Ceramax" fell over inside the trailer and fizzed around the cap and began to swell. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental Services to conduct all onsite cleanup operations. At 2059 ET, Patriot confirmed approximately (2)-cups of product released affecting a 6’ x 6’ areas of the trailer/dock floors. Patriot collected and containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallons overpacked poly drum and all clean-up debris into one (1) 55-gallons poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
